POWER DOWN

PG&E pleads guilty to 84 manslaughter counts in deadliest California wildfire

THE PG&E Corporation has pleaded guilty to involuntary manslaughter over the deadliest wildfire in California history. The 2018 wildfire in Butte County that killed 85 broke out after a metal 'c-hook' broke off from a transmission tower, allowing a high-voltage power to fall and start the flames in the brush below.

Link: https://www.the-sun.com/news/992394/pge-plead-guilty-84-manslaughter-counts/

News Link: https://www.the-sun.com/news/
